articles.description: Premier League reaction as Newcastle beat Sheffield United 8-0, Arsenal and Tottenham play out thrilling north London derby draw, plus more.
articles.title: Spurs hold Arsenal & Newcastle thump Sheff Utd - reaction

articles.description: Wales will head to Marseille for a World Cup quarter-final following a record 40-6 win over Australia in Lyon.
articles.title: Special night in Lyon leads Wales to Marseille

articles.description: Jurgen Klopp's remodelled Reds team is a reminder of what his best Liverpool sides have always been like, says MOTD2 pundit Shay Given.
articles.title: 'Liverpool 2.0 reminds me of Klopp's best teams'

articles.description: Suzann Pettersen called her players "legends" as Europe lifted the Solheim Cup for a third consecutive occasion at Finca Cortesin.
articles.title: Pettersen hails Europe's Solheim 'legends'

articles.description: The death of Sheffield United player Maddy Cusack is not being treated as suspicious, police have said.
articles.title: Cusack death not suspicious, say police

articles.description: Watch 2 Good 2 Bad from Match of the Day 2, featuring a bad miss and stunning goal by Liverpool's Darwin Nunez, goalkeeper celebrations and a referee fumble.
articles.title: Nunez stunners, goalkeeper celebrations and a referee fumble

articles.description: Tiago Rech had a moment of global fame as the only away fan to attend an FC Santa Cruz game. It was just the beginning of his remarkable story.
articles.title: The lone away fan who led his club to glory

articles.description: Despite Australia facing a first-ever group stage elimination at the Rugby World Cup, sacking coach Eddie Jones is "the worst thing" the Wallabies can do according to former captain Stirling Mortlock.
articles.title: 'Sacking Jones is worst thing Australia can do'

articles.description: Meet the sportspeople and organisations who are using the power of sport to help create a more sustainable future.
articles.title: Green Sport Awards nominees announced

articles.description: There's a big injury concern for France while Ireland see off the defending champions - here are the main headlines from week three of the Rugby World Cup.
articles.title: What happened in week three at Rugby World Cup?
